data.event: The town of Lapog was established in 1772.

event.title: year 1772, Don Tomas Aquino, the first local leader, initiated

data.event: In the year 1772, Don Tomas Aquino, the first local leader, initiated the organization of the scattered communities into one, calling the place "Lapog", a derivative of local vernacular "Lap-Lapog" which means unirrigated land.
For 189 years, "Lapog" remained in the records as the official name of the town until June 18, 1961, Republic Act No. 3386 was enacted and it was renamed to San Juan.

event.title: June 18, 1961, Republic Act No. 3386 was enacted

data.event: For 189 years, "Lapog" remained in the records as the official name of the town until June 18, 1961, Republic Act No. 3386 was enacted and it was renamed to San Juan.
